title: Orlando Bloom relaxes while Katy Perry parties at Grammys | Daily Mail Online
text: comments It was Katy Perry's big return to the spotlight - her performance of Chained To The Rhythm at the Grammys on Sunday night. But while she was entertaining millions of viewers, her boyfriend Orlando Bloom wasn't among the audience - preferring instead to relax at Malibu's branch of the exclusive Soho House. The actor was snapped walking into the private member's club alongside the scenic Pacific Ocean on Sunday. Orlando Bloom relaxes at Malibu's Soho House... while Katy Perry parties the night away at the Grammys Party time:While Orlando relaxed by the Pacific Ocean, Katy partied it up at the Grammys; she is seen here at the Universal label's afterparty As he did so Katy was prepping for her big night - following a nearly three-year break from the limelight following the release of 2013's Prism. And what a storming comeback it was, as she donned a white pantsuit to perform the catchy track beside a house surrounded by a white picket fence. While Orlando, 40, may not have been there to cheer 32-year-old Katy on, there is no doubt the couple are close. 'No hate': Katy got political in her debut performance of her new single Chained To The Rhythm at the Grammys on Sunday night. Jump: She was joined onstage by Skip Marley, grandson of the late reggae great, Bob They have been dating for more than a year and last month Katy threw a surprise party to celebrate Orlando's 40th birthday. The Firework hitmaker delighted her boyfriend with a star-studded bash in Palm Springs, where they were joined by a host of pals, including Amanda De Cadenet, Jennifer Aniston and her husband Justin Theroux. But the highlight of the evening for the British actor was a surprise appearance from his mother. Shiny: Katy turned up to the awards in a curious ensemble He shared a photograph of them embracing on Instagram and wrote: 'Best gift ever surprise visit from me mum.' It was previously claimed the singer had also hired a celebrity concierge service to plan 12 months' worth of events to celebrate Orlando's birthday. A source said recently: 'Katy is determined to make this year the best ever and is not letting money get in the way. She wants a combination of holidays and 'bucket list' experiences, including seeing some of the world's most famous sights.' GRAMMY AWARDS 2017 WINNERS
